intro: Lapeirousia rhodesiana, commonly known as the Rhodes bulbous orchid, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous roots and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically blooms in spring, producing clusters of vivid yellow or orange flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
